title: Basic Needs and Wants

vocab.definition: Something you must have to live and be healthy
Something you would like to have but don't need
A place to live that keeps you safe and warm

teachingNotes: Use pictures and sorting activities. Discuss family decisions about spending money. Connect to students' experiences.

sample.question: Is food a need or a want?
Is water a need or a want?
Is a toy a need or a want?
Is a warm coat a need or a want?
Is ice cream a need or a want?
Is a house (shelter) a need or a want?
Is a bike a need or a want?

truefalse.question: Everyone needs a place to live.
Clothing helps keep us safe and warm.
You can buy everything you want all the time.
Food is a need for everyone.

multiplechoice.question: Which is NOT a basic need?
What should a family buy first?
A warm coat in winter is a ___

fillintheblank.question: Water, food, clothing, and _____ are basic needs.
A _____ is something you would like to have.
A _____ is something you must have to live.
Families make _____ because they can't buy everything.
Healthy food helps your _____ grow strong.

shortanswer.question: Why do families have to make choices about what to buy?
What is one thing you need every day?
What is something you want but don't need?
How can you help your family with choices?
Give one example of a need and one of a want.
How do you feel when your needs are met?
